org.neontoolkit.registry.api
Class Oyster2Connection

java.lang.Object
  org.neontoolkit.registry.api.Oyster2Connection

public class Oyster2Connection
extends java.lang.Object

The class Oyster2Connection provides the API access methods to Oyster2 registry.

Version:
2.2, September 2008
Author:
Raul Palma

Method Detail

register

public void register(java.lang.Object o)
Register a new object into Oyster2 registry.

Parameters:
o - is the registry object representing that will be registered.

replace

public void replace(java.lang.Object o)
Replaces an existing object in Oyster2 registry with the new information provided. If the object does not exists, it is registered.

Parameters:
o - is the object that will be replaced.

remove

public void remove(java.lang.Object o)
Removes an existing object in Oyster2 registry

Parameters:
o - is the object (or reference to the object) that will be removed.

search

public java.util.Set<java.lang.Object> search(java.lang.Object o)
Search Oyster2 local registry to retrieve all available metadata entries that fulfill certain conditions.

Parameters:
o - is an object that holds the conditions that will be used for searching the registry.
Returns:
The set of objects representing the ontology metadata entries and that fulfill the conditions.

search

public java.util.Set<java.lang.Object> search(java.lang.Object o,
                                              int scope,
                                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,OMVPeer> peerSet)
Search Oyster2 registry to retrieve all available metadata entries that fulfill certain conditions within a certain scope and (if specified) a certain set of Peers.

Parameters:
o - is an object that holds the conditions that will be used for searching the registry.
scope - integer that represents the scope of the search (use predefined values in Oyster2Query i.e. Local_Scope, Auto_Scope, Selected_Scope)
peerSet - is the map of pairs (URI,OMVPeer object) representing the set of peers that will be included in the search. If not specified (i.e. peerSet=null) Oyster will decide which peers to query according to its knowledge
Returns:
The set of objects representing the metadata entries and that fulfill the conditions.

submitAdHocQuery

public java.util.Set<java.lang.Object> submitAdHocQuery(java.lang.String sparqlQuery)
Send a SPARQL query to Oyster2 local registry and returns the metadata entries that are part of the result.

Parameters:
sparqlQuery - is the SPARQL query as a string.
Returns:
The set of OMVOntology objects representing the ontology metadata entries that matched the query.

submitAdHocQuery

public java.util.Set<java.lang.Object> submitAdHocQuery(java.lang.String sparqlQuery,
                                                        int scope,
                                                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,OMVPeer> peerSet)
Send a SPARQL query to Oyster2 registry and returns the metadata entries that are part of the result within a certain scope and (if specified)a certain set of Peers.

Parameters:
sparqlQuery - is the SPARQL query as a string.
scope - integer that represents the scope of the search (use predefined values in Oyster2Query i.e. Local_Scope, Auto_Scope, Selected_Scope)
peerSet - is the map of pairs (URI,OMVPeer object) representing the set of peers that will be included in the search. If not specified (i.e. peerSet=null) Oyster will decide which peers to query according to its knowledge
Returns:
The set of OMVOntology objects representing the ontology metadata entries that matched the query.

importOntology

public boolean importOntology(java.lang.String URL)
Opens an ontology file, extracts the ontology metadata and import it into Oyster2 registry. If the ontology does already exists, it is merged. It is not allowed to use blank spaces in the path of an ontology, since this string (the path of the ontology) should be a normal url (java.net.URI). But you can use %20 instead of a blank space

Parameters:
URL - is the path or URL of the ontology file.
Returns:
true/false if the import was successful

getOntologies

public java.util.Set<OMVOntology> getOntologies()
Search Oyster2 local registry to retrieve all available ontology metadata entries.

Returns:
The set of OMVOntology objects representing the ontology metadata entries.

getOntologies

public java.util.Set<OMVOntology> getOntologies(int scope,
                                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,OMVPeer> peerSet)
Search Oyster2 registry to retrieve all available ontology metadata entries within a certain scope and (if specified) a certain set of Peers.

Parameters:
scope - integer that represents the scope of the search (use predefined values in Oyster2Query i.e. Local_Scope, Auto_Scope, Selected_Scope)
peerSet - is the map of pairs (URI,OMVPeer object) representing the set of peers that will be included in the search. If not specified (i.e. peerSet=null) Oyster will decide which peers to query according to its knowledge
Returns:
The set of OMVOntology objects representing the ontology metadata entries.

getOntologies

public java.util.Set<OMVOntology> getOntologies(java.util.Date fromDate)
Search Oyster2 local registry to retrieve all available ontology metadata entries that were registered after certain date.

Parameters:
fromDate - is the date from which to start the search.
Returns:
The set of OMVOntology objects representing the ontology metadata entries and that were registered after the date provided.

getOntologies

public java.util.Set<OMVOntology> getOntologies(java.util.Date fromDate,
                                                int scope,
                                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,OMVPeer> peerSet)
Search Oyster2 registry to retrieve all available ontology metadata entries that were registered after certain date, within a certain scope and (if specified)a certain set of Peers.

Parameters:
fromDate - is the date from which to start the search.
scope - integer that represents the scope of the search (use predefined values in Oyster2Query i.e. Local_Scope, Auto_Scope, Selected_Scope)
peerSet - is the map of pairs (URI,OMVPeer object) representing the set of peers that will be included in the search. If not specified (i.e. peerSet=null) Oyster will decide which peers to query according to its knowledge
Returns:
The set of OMVOntology objects representing the ontology metadata entries and that were registered after the date provided.

getOntologies

public java.util.Set<OMVOntology> getOntologies(java.lang.String keyword)
Search Oyster2 local registry to retrieve all available ontology metadata entries that contains the input keyword in any part of any of their data properties. Implements a keword match search.

Parameters:
keyword - is the keyword to search in the ontology properties.
Returns:
The set of OMVOntology objects representing the ontology metadata entries that matched the keyword.

getOntologies

public java.util.Set<OMVOntology> getOntologies(java.lang.String keyword,
                                                int scope,
                                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,OMVPeer> peerSet)
Search Oyster2 registry to retrieve all available ontology metadata entries that contains the input keyword in any part of any of their data properties. Implements a keword match search within a certain scope and (if specified)a certain set of Peers.

Parameters:
keyword - is the keyword to search in the ontology properties.
scope - integer that represents the scope of the search (use predefined values in Oyster2Query i.e. Local_Scope, Auto_Scope, Selected_Scope)
peerSet - is the map of pairs (URI,OMVPeer object) representing the set of peers that will be included in the search. If not specified (i.e. peerSet=null) Oyster will decide which peers to query according to its knowledge
Returns:
The set of OMVOntology objects representing the ontology metadata entries that matched the keyword.

getPeers

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,OMVPeer> getPeers()
Retrieves the peers discovered in Oyster2 registry.

Returns:
The set of OMVPeer objects representing the peers discovered by Oyster2.

getPeerExpertise

public java.util.Set<OMVOntology> getPeerExpertise(java.lang.String peerURI,
                                                   OMVPeer peer)
Retrieves the ontologies available at a certain peer.

Parameters:
peerURI - the URI of the peer
peer - the OMVPeer object representing the peer to be searched.
Returns:
The set of OMVOntology objects representing the ontologies available in that peer.

Returns:
The set of OMVMapping objects representing the mapping metadata entries.

getMappings

public java.util.Set<OMVMapping> getMappings(int scope,
                                             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,OMVPeer> peerSet)
Search Oyster2 registry to retrieve all available mappings metadata entries within a certain scope and (if specified ) a certain set of Peers.

Parameters:
scope - integer that represents the scope of the search (use predefined values in Oyster2Query i.e. Local_Scope, Auto_Scope, Selected_Scope)
peerSet - is the map of pairs (URI,OMVPeer object) representing the set of peers that will be included in the search. If not specified (i.e. peerSet=null) Oyster will decide which peers to query according to its knowledge
Returns:

getChanges

public java.util.List<OMVChange> getChanges(OMVOntology o,
                                            java.lang.String fromChange)
Search Oyster2 registry to retrieve all available changes for a specific ontology in historical order, starting with the specified change.

Parameters:
o - is the specified ontology
fromChange - is the starting point in the change history. If not specified (i.e. fromChange=null) this method returns the complete history
Returns:
The list of OMVChanges objects representing the ontology changes.

getChanges

public java.util.Set<OMVChange> getChanges(OMVOntology o,
                                           OMVChange c,
                                           java.lang.String fromChange)
Search Oyster2 registry to retrieve changes of specific kind for a specific ontology.

Parameters:
o - is the specified ontology.
c - is the kind of ontology change Use predefined classes of the API i.e. new OMVEntityChange().
fromChange - is the starting point in the change history. If not specified (i.e. fromChange=null) this method returns the complete history
Returns:
The set of OMVChanges objects representing the ontology changes.

getTrackedChangesSet

public java.util.Set<OMVChange> getTrackedChangesSet(OMVOntology o)
Search Oyster2 registry to retrieve all available changes for a specific ontology without any order

Parameters:
o - is the specified ontology
Returns:
The set of OMVChanges objects representing the ontology changes.

getOntologiesWithChanges

public java.util.Set<OMVOntology> getOntologiesWithChanges()
Search Oyster2 registry to retrieve all ontologies with change history.

Returns:
The set of OMVOntology objects

getLastChangeId

public java.lang.String getLastChangeId()
Gets the URI of the last change succesfully registered in Oyster. This URI is in memory, which is faster than the similar method getLastChangeIdFromLog, but if Oyster is restarted or in another session this information is lost

Returns:
The string of the last change registered

getAtomicChanges

public java.util.Set<OMVChange.OMVAtomicChange> getAtomicChanges(OMVChange.OMVEntityChange c)
Gets the set of atomic changes for a specific entity change

Parameters:
c - is the entity change for which for which we want to search atomic changes
Returns:
The set of atomic changes

Gets the entity associated to a specific change

Parameters:
changeURI - is the uri of the change for which for which we want to search the related entity
Returns:
The uri of the related entity

o - is the OMVOntology to track

Parameters:

syncrhonizeChangesWithKnownPeersNow

public void syncrhonizeChangesWithKnownPeersNow()
Force to start the syncrhonization of changes with all known peers. A new thread is created to do the job

startDiscoveryComponent

public void startDiscoveryComponent()
If it this peer was configured as simple peer the discovery process can be started/stoped later on. If this is a normal peer this call is ignored

stopDiscoveryComponent

public void stopDiscoveryComponent()
If it this peer was configured as simple peer the discovery process can be started/stoped later on. If this is a normal peer this call is ignored

                               OMVPerson p)
Submit a change to be approved

Parameters:
changeURI - is the URI of the change editor sends to be approved
p - is the editor submitting the change

Parameters:

                               OMVPerson p)

Parameters:

                             OMVPerson p)

delete

public void delete(java.lang.String changeURI,
                   OMVPerson p)
Delete an element permanently from the ontology. This action sends the change to deleted state

Parameters:
changeURI - is the URI of the change that the ontology editor approves to be deleted
p - is the editor approving the permanent delelition of the element.

publish

public void publish(OMVOntology fromPublicVersion,
                    OMVOntology toPublicVersion,
                    OMVPerson p)
Publish an ontology

Parameters:
fromPublicVersion - is the URI of the previous version of the ontology
toPublicVersion - is the URI of the next version of the ontology
p - is the editor publising the ontology

removeWorkflowHistory

public void removeWorkflowHistory(OMVOntology o)
Removes all the history of workflow in Oyster for the specified ontology

Parameters:
o - is the ontology for which we want to remove workflow history

getEntityActionsHistory

public java.util.List<Action> getEntityActionsHistory(OMVOntology o,
                                                      java.lang.String fromChange)
Gets the history of entity actions applied to the ontology

Parameters:
o - is the ontology for which we want to get the history
fromChange - is the starting point in the change history. If not specified (i.e. fromChange=null) this method returns the complete history.
Returns:
the sorted list of entity actions.

the ontology action.
